title: Tomato 🍅 Chutney's - 3 Ways | Side Dish | Breakfast
content:
Side Dish: Breakfast: South India 🇮🇳  In Indian breakfast recipes there must be a tasty side dish which varies from one breakfast to another, some of the side dishes suits to more than 3 breakfast recipes. For example coconut chutney goes well with plain Dosa, onion uttapam, Idly , Poori etc., You can checkout my Coriander Coconut Chutney / Kothimeera Kobbari Chutney Like wise, mostly South Indian breakfast dishes should serve with any flavoured side dish. So today I would like to share three different chutney's they are  simple to make and perfect combination for any South Indian breakfast recipes. Today I prepared three tomato chutney 🍅 with other spices . Let's start with Ingredients and follows Procedure Duration : 30 mins Prepreparation: ( Basic step to all Chutney's ) Step 1:
  •  Heat pan add chopped tomatoes 🍅 and cook 4 - 5 minutes
  • Keep it aside
Step 2: ( Common for all Chutney's ) For Tempering: Mustard seeds/ Avvalu - 1 tea spoon Cumin seeds/ Jeera - 1 tea spoon Curry leaves - 6 Oil - 1 tb sp
  • Heat a tempering pan over medium heat
  • Add oil
  • Add mustard seeds and cumin seeds
  • Let them splutter
  • Next add curry leaves 🍃
  • Saute & turn off heat
  • Keep it aside
Tomato Peanuts 🥜 Chutney: Ingredients:
  • Tomatoes - 1 - medium - diced
  • Roasted Peanuts - 1/3 cup - 80gms
  • Green chillies - 3 - chopped
  • Salt - 1 tsp
Procedure:
  • Heat pan add tomatoes and cook 5 mins
  • Keep it aside
  • In another pan add oil & add chopped green chillies
  • Saute 1 min & Keep it aside
  • Let them become cool
  • Add cooked tomatoes, roasted peanuts, green chillies and salt in mixer grinder
  • Blend till smooth paste
  • If required Add little water to make smooth paste
  • Take out chutney in a bowl
  • Add prepared tempering on chutney
  • Serve it with any breakfast especially South Indian breakfast such as Idly,
  • Plain Dosa
  • Onion 🥕 Uttapam
  • Ghee Podi Masala Dosa😋|| Breakfast|| Restaurant Style
  • Green gram Dosa/ Pesara Attu/ Moong Dal Dosa
  • Chapathi/ Roti
Step by step shown below with pictures:   Garlic Tomato 🍅Chutney: Ingredients:
  • Tomatoes - 2 - medium - diced
  • Garlic cloves - 4 - medium - peeled off & chopped
  • Red chilly powder - 1/2 tb sp
  • Salt - 1 tsp
  • Tamarind extract - 1/2 inch piece
  • Jaggery Powder - 1/2 tb sp
Procedure:
  • Heat pan add tomatoes, garlic, red chilly powder,tamarind extract, salt and cook 5 mins
  • Keep it aside
  • Let them become cool
  • Add cooked tomatoes with garlic and other spices in mixer grinder
  • Blend till smooth paste
  • If required Add little water to make smooth paste
  • Take out chutney in a bowl
  • Add prepared tempering on chutney
  • Serve it with any breakfast ( Breakfast links mentioned above )
Step by step process shown below with pictures: Onion Tomato 🍅 Chutney: Ingredients:
  • Tomato - 1 - medium - diced
  • Onion - 1 - small - diced
  • Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Cumin seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Urad Dal - 1 tsp
  • Bengal gram - 1 tsp
  • Fenugreek seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Oil - 1/2 tb sp
  • Salt - 1 tsp
  • Green chillies - 3 - chopped
Procedure:
  • Heat pan over medium heat
  • Add oil, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, Urad Dal, Bengal gram, fenugreek seeds, curry leaves, green chillies
  • Let them splutter
  • Add onions and chopped tomatoes
  • Cook 5 mins
  • Keep it aside
  • Let them become cool
  • Add cooked tomatoes and onion with ingredients in mixer grinder
  • Blend till smooth paste
  • If required Add little water to make smooth paste
  • Take out chutney in a bowl
  • Add prepared tempering on chutney
  • Serve it with any breakfast ( Breakfast recipes link mentioned above )
Step by step process shown below with pictures: Note:
  • Adjust Spices and salt according to taste
  • Double the ingredients to increase quantity
  • Contains peanuts & garlic
  • In tomato peanuts Chutney I used whole peanuts with skin. If you doesn't like you can remove skin on peanuts and then add in blender
  • These chutney's can preserve in refrigerator for 3 days
  • If you are storing in refrigerator, store chutney in an airtight container
